channel.title: I Am Athlete Podcast
channel.description: I Am Athlete is a media company focused on the intersection of business, entertainment , music, and sports. Founded by former NFL wide receiver Brandon Marshall, and hosted with Adam "Pacman" Jones, LeSean "Shady" McCoy, and special guests. IAA creates athlete-led content that resembles a “locker room”— a safe space for athletes and celebrities to tell their stories and have a voice while feeling comfortable amongst one another. All shows are unscripted and unfiltered, unravelling cultural discussions centered around sports, wellness, music, culture, fashion, and mental health. #BiggerThanAPodcast
channel.itunes:summary: I Am Athlete is a media company focused on the intersection of business, entertainment , music, and sports. Founded by former NFL wide receiver Brandon Marshall, and hosted with Adam "Pacman" Jones, LeSean "Shady" McCoy, and special guests. IAA creates athlete-led content that resembles a “locker room”— a safe space for athletes and celebrities to tell their stories and have a voice while feeling comfortable amongst one another. All shows are unscripted and unfiltered, unravelling cultural discussions centered around sports, wellness, music, culture, fashion, and mental health. #BiggerThanAPodcast
channel.itunes:author: Brandon Marshall, SiriusXM

item.title: IAA Tonight | Is Odell Beckham Jr. Headed to a Contender?
item.description: CBS Sports Josina Anderson jumps onboard to discuss all the latest in the NFL news, and if Odell Beckham Jr. will be heading back to the field soon. Is he close to signing with a team in contention. Plus, Super Bowl Champ and Seahawks great Cliff Avril chimes in on the Russell Wilson situation that's been brewing in Denver.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, Brandon Marshall, Cliff Avril)

item.title: IAA Tonight | James Harden Out for a Month AND Brandin Cooks Stuck in Houston
item.description: Sixers All-Star G James Harden will be out for a month with a foot injury. How will this affect the Sixers and their championship aspirations? Plus, Houston Texans receiver Brandin Cooks will be stepping away from the team after not being traded before the deadline. Is this the right approach for the veteran receiver? Leger Douzable, Adam Pacman Jones, and Brandon Flowers gives their thoughts.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Adam Pacman Jones, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Dan Snyder Possibly Selling the Washington Commanders?
item.description: Washington Commanders owners Dan and Tanya Snyder have hired Bank of America Securities to "consider potential transactions," including the potential sale of the franchise. LeSean "Shady McCoy, Adam "Pacman" Jones, and Leger Douzable discuss the franchise possibly changing owners, and if the Miami Dolphins put themselves in Super Bowl contention with the addition of Bradley Chubb.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, LeSean McCoy, Adam Pacman Jones)

item.title: IAA Tonight | NFL Trade Deadline Winners & Losers AND The Nets To Hire Ime Udoka?
item.description: The NFL trade deadline day was the most active its ever been and included Bradley Chubb, T.J. Hockensen, and Nyheim Hines on the move while Brandin Cooks and Kareem Hunt stay put. LeSean McCoy, Leger Douzable, and Brandon Flowers discuss those moves, and the Brooklyn Nets and Steve Nash mutually parting ways and suspended Boston Celtics head coach Ime Udoka possibly being his replacement.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, LeSean McCoy, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Christian McCaffrey Completes TD Trifecta AND Michigan vs. Michigan St. Tunnel Brawl
item.description: The addition of Christian McCaffrey is paying off immensely for the San Francisco 49ers. The All-Pro running back scored three touchdowns on Sunday by rushing, passing and receiving. Would a fully healthy 49ers squad possibly be able to beat the undefeated Eagles in the NFC? Pacman Jones, Antoine Walker and Leger Douzable discuss that and the tunnel brawl that happened after Michigan def. Michigan St. in Ann Arbor on Saturday. One hosts believes that it would be ridiculous for charges to be filed.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Adam Pacman Jones, Antoine Walker)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Brady and the Bucs Continue to Struggle AND Russell Westbrook Off the Bench?
item.description: Tom Brady and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers continue to struggle after falling to the Baltimore Ravens 27-22 on Thursday Night Football. Could Tom's personal life be affecting his play, or is the team just overall bad and won't be able to compete in the NFC? Plus, Russell Westbrook will be coming off the bench for the forseeable future. Is this the correct move for the Lakers to be making?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Chantel Tremetiere, Omar Kelly)

item.title: IAA Tonight | How Can the Lakers Fix Their Problems? AND Ben Simmons Continues to Struggle.
item.description: The Lakers have a lot of holes to fix, but how can they fix them? What moves can be made in order for them to be a viable championship contender? Plus, Ben Simmons continues to struggle, and one host doesn't hold back on their thoughts about his shortcomings in Brooklyn thus far this season.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Mac Jones Remains the Starter AND Do the Chicago Bears Need New Ownership?
item.description: The Philadelphia Eagles traded for veteran pass-rusher Robert Quinn from the Chicago Bears Wednesday for a fourth-round pick. The trade had Quinn's now former teammate Roquan Smith fighting back tears at his press conference. Are the Bears in need of a revamp at the ownership level? Former Bears WR Brandon Marshall, LeSean McCoy, and Leger Douzable discuss that and Mac Jones remaining as the starter in New England.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, LeSean Mccoy, Brandon MArshall)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Is Bill Belichick Still the Greatest Coach of All Time? AND Are the Lakers In Trouble?
item.description: Coming off a bad Monday Night Football loss to the Chicago Bears at home, the New England Patriots now find themselves in a QB conundrum after benching 2021 first-round pick Mac Jones in favor of 2022 fourth-round pick Bailey Zappe. LeSean McCoy, Adam Pacman Jones, and Leger Douzable discuss the Patriots QB woes, and the status Bill Belichick in the pantheon of great coaches. Plus, should LeBron and the Lakers be panicking just three games into the season?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, LeSean McCoy, Adam Pacman Jones)

item.title: IAA Tonight | The New York Jets Keep Winning! AND The World Series is Set.
item.description: Matt Ryan has officially been benched in favor of backup QB Sam Ehlinger. Should Matty Ice, the former MVP, hang 'em up? Also, Douz's Jets are on a roll but star rookie Breece Hall is out for the season with a torn ACL, however a new reinforcement is on the way. Also, the Phillies and Astros are headed to the Worlds Series. We give you a quick preview of how things might turnout.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar KElly, Adam Pacman Jones)

Plus, Omar Kelly, Brandon Flowers, Antoine Walker, and Leger Douzable make their Week 7 picks, and hit the start of the NBA season. Has the tanking for Victor Wembanyama ALREADY begun?

item.title: IAA Tonight | Dak and Zion are Back!
item.description: Dak Prescott is back and ready to start for the Cowboys against the Lions this Sunday, but is he fully ready to go? One host believes he should rest a few more weeks. Plus, Zion Williamson is back and looks like he's in incredible shape after his outstanding performance against the Brooklyn Nets on Wednesday. How good is this Pelicans squad with Brandon Ingram and CJ McCollum?

item.title: IAA Tonight | NFL Owners Beef AND Is Tom Brady No Longer Enjoying the Game?
item.description: There's seems to be some beef amongst NFL owners, and perhaps between the two biggest in Robert Kraft and Jerry Jones when they were discussing what commissioner Roger Goodell should be compensated for his position. Plus, Colts owner Jim Irsay said Washington Commanders owner Dan Snyder should possibly be removed for all of the controversies he's been involved in. What is happening between one of the most tight-lipped groups we've ever seen. Also, is Tom Brady no longer enjoying the game? One of his old foes believes so.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Lesean MCcoy, LEger Douzable)

item.itunes:author: Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones, Kyle Kuzma
item.itunes:summary:
Kyle Kuzma sits down with the I Am Athlete crew in Washington D.C. to discuss the challenges that come with NBA fan, what it was like to be a teammate with Lebron James, winning a championship with the Lakers in the bubble, and then challenges of turning the Washington Wizards into a winning franchise.
I Am Athlete goes ON TOUR! A live tour in front of a packed audience in cities across the country. In this episode we are in Washington, D.C. During these live interactive tapings of I AM ATHLETE, the hosts invite special Athletes and Entertainers with them on stage to discuss the latest news and biggest hot topics and stories in sports, entertainment and culture.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Who's the Best Team In the NFL? AND The NBA is Back!!!
item.description: The Philadelphia Eagles and the Buffalo Bills have been rolling all season, but are they the two best teams in the NFL? LeSean "Shady" McCoy, Leger Douzable and Omar Kelly discuss that and if Dallas should be playing Cooper Rush over Dak Prescott. Plus, the NBA is back! The guys discuss which teams are the best out of their respective conferences and if the Warriors will repeat.

item.title: IAA Tonight | New York Football is Back AND Steelers Stump Brady and the Bucs
item.description: The Giants and the Jets have New York football fans excited about their teams again after the Giants defeated 2019 MVP Lamar Jackson and the Ravens, and the Jets defeated reigning MVP Aaron Rodgers and the Packers. Leger Douzable, Adam Pacman Jones and Brandon Flowers discuss what has attributed to the turnaround for both teams. Plus, Tom Brady was spotted at Robert Kraft's wedding on Friday, but should he have been in Pittsburgh preparing for the game instead?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Pacman Jones, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Tom Brady Gets Fined AND Russell Westbrook Comes Off the Bench
item.description: Tom Brady was fined for trying to trip Grady Jarrett during Sunday's game, but should he have been suspended instead? Justin Fields is seemingly becoming more frustrated with the Bears after a tough loss on Thursday Night to the Commanders. Why aren't the Bears doing as much as they can to surround their QB with talent. Plus, what is going on with Russ and the Lakers?

item.title: IAA Tonight | 2019 NFL DPOY & Colts CB Stephon Gilmore Joins the Show!
item.description: 2019 Defensive Player of the Year, 2x First-team All-Pro, 5x Pro Bowler, Super Bowl Champion, and Colts CB Stephon Gilmore joins the show to discuss his game saving play against the Broncos on Thursday Night, Brady and Belichick, why corners aren't performing at a high level, and comparisons between him and Darrelle Revis. Brandon Marshall, LeSean McCoy, and Leger Douzable also discuss the questionable roughing the passer calls that occured during the Buccaneers vs. Falcons and Raiders vs. Chiefs.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Brandon Marshall, Omar Kelly, Stephon Gilmore)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Matt Rhule Fired AND Ron Rivera Calls Out His QB
item.description: The Carolina Panthers have parted ways with head coach Matt Rhule, the team announced Monday. The move comes a day after a 37-15 loss to the San Francisco 49ers which left the Panthers with a 1-4 record on the season. This firing led to our discussion on college coaches transitioning to the NFL, and why more times than not they ultimately fail. Plus, did Washington Commanders head coach Ron Rivera call out QB Carson Wentz?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Adam Pacman Jones, Omar KElly)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Russ Hasn't Been Cooking AND Draymond Punches Jordan Poole
item.description: Russell Wilson struggled mightily on Thursday Night Football against the Indianapolis Colts, and has been receiving major backlash for his lackluster performances to start the season. Is Russ cooked? Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, and Auntie Chantel Tremetiere discuss the Denver Broncos $250 million QB. Plus, Draymond Green viciously punched Warriors teammate Jordan Poole in practice. We discuss if he was in the wrong and how should Jordan Poole feel about him as a teammate.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar KElly, Chantel Tremetiere)

item.title: IAA Tonight | LeBron Wants to Own a Team AND Tom Brady Says There's A Lot of Bad Football
item.description: As if he doesn't already have his hands in enough business ventures already, LeBron James wants to own an NBA team and put it in Las Vegas. How realistic is it that one of the most popular players in league history will end up owning a team in the biggest party city in the USA? Plus, Tom Brady believes that there's a lot of bad football being played. Does he have a valid point?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Former NFL DE John Abraham Joins the Show!
item.description: Former NFL DE and should be Hall of Famer John Abraham joins the show to talk about his career and HoF resume, life after football dealing with concussions, how defensive lineman are finally getting the respect they deserve, and what's next for him in life.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Aaron Judge Sets American League All-Time Single-Season Home Run Record
item.description: Aaron Judge is the American League’s all-time single-season home run king. The New York Yankees superstar surpassed Roger Maris's record with his 62nd homer of 2022 during our show! LeSean McCoy, Leger Douzable and Adam Pacman Jones discuss the historic run by the Yankees slugger as it happened on air.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, LeSean Mccoy, Adam Pacman Jones)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Are the Eagles the Best Team in the NFL?
item.description: Baltimore Ravens CB Marcus Peters was visibly frustrated and seen yelling towards coach John Harbaugh on the sideline for another late game collapse. Why can't the Ravens close out games with big leads? Plus, are the Philadelphia Eagles the best team in the NFL as they remain undefeated on the season at 4-0?

item.title: IAA Tonight | Tua's Injury is a Wake-Up Call.
item.description: Dolphins QB Tua Tagovailoa was taken from the field on a stretcher during Thursday’s game against the Bengals and transported by ambulance to a hospital after suffering a concussion, according to team officials, on a first-half hit. Many believe that the situation was botched since he was allowed to return to the game Sunday after appearing dazed from taking a hit against the Buffalo Bills. Realistically, what should the proper steps and protocols be to prevent a situation like this from happening again. Brandon Marshall, Omar Kelly and Antoine Walker discuss.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Omar Kelly, Antoine Walker)
item.itunes:title: IAA Tonight | Tua's Injury is a Wake-Up Call.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Brady and Mahomes Set to Faceoff AND The NFL Top WR Trios
item.description: Tom Brady and Patrick Mahomes are set to play each other again in the first meeting between the Super Bowl-winning quarterbacks since the Bucs trounced the Chiefs in the Super Bowl title game two seasons ago. Who's has the upper hand in this matchup of two of the greatest. Plus, Brandon Marshall breaksdown the best WR trios in the NFL today.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, Brandon Marshall)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Should Tua Have Been Allowed to Finish the Game?
item.description: Miami Dolphins QB Tua Tagovailoa appeared to be concussed after taking a hit against the Buffalo Bills this past Sunday but passed concussion protocols and remained in the game. Brandon Marshall, LeSean McCoy and Leger Douzable discuss some of the risks they and other athletes have taken in order to stay in games and play through injuries.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, LeSean McCoy, Brandon Marshall)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Patrick Mahomes and Eric Bieniemy Beefing AND Are Kevin Durant and Kyrie Irving Cool?
item.description: Patrick Mahomes and Chiefs offensive coordinator Eric Bieniemy shared a heated moment as the two walked off the field to the team’s locker room on Sunday as Kansas City held a 14–10 halftime lead against the Colts. Former Chiefs RB and IAA host LeSean McCoy has some interesting thoughts about the dispute. Plus, the NBA season is around the corner and Kevin Durant and Kyrie Irving have finally spoke after a tumultuous summer. How do the Nets stack up in the Eastern Conference?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (LEger Douzable, LeSean McCoy, Antoine Walker)

item.title: I AM ATHLETE | REGGIE BUSH: “Give Me My Heisman back.”
item.description:
SUBSCRIBE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE?sub_confirmation=1 WATCH MORE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE
I AM ATHLETE | SEASON 3 - Episode 52 Reggie Bush joins Brandon Marshall, Adam "Pacman" Jones, and LeSean "Shady" McCoy and in episode 52 of I Am Athlete. Reggie opens up about the depression he battled early in his NFL career because of the NCAA probe he and the USC Trojans faced because of claims he and his family profited from his collegiate career. Bush hopes a recent multi-million settlement the NCAA paid to his former position coach will help clear his name, and potentially lead to the Heisman Trophy taken away from him being returned.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Fallout From Ime Udoka's Suspension AND Previewing the NFL Weekend
item.description: The Boston Celtics have suspended Head Coach Ime Udoka for the 2022-23 season and cited violations of team policies in their statement. Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly and Auntie Chantel Tremetiere react to the news and what this means for the franchise. Plus, there is a good slate of NFL games this weekend, including Tom Brady vs. Aaron Rodgers as the Tampa Bay Buccaneers are set to face the Green Bay Packers on Sunday. Find out their predictions on that game and more!
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, Chantel Tremetiere)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Ime Udoka is in Trouble, Ben Simmons Speaks AND Brett Favre's Scandal
item.description: Boston Celtics Head Coach Ime Udoka has been suspended for the 2022-23 season for violations of team policies. Leger Douzable and Brandon Flowers discuss what this means for the defending Eastern Conference Champions and if this ruins their chance of having a deep playoff run. Ben Simmons finally spoke about his time in Philly. Plus, former NFL quarterback Brett Favre has been mired for months in a welfare-funds controversy in his home state of Mississippi.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Robert Sarver Selling the Suns AND Pro Football Hall of Fame Nominees
item.description: Phoenix Suns and Mercury owner Robert Sarver has announced that he began the process of selling the franchises after being suspended for one-year for using racist and misogynistic language. Leger Douzable and Brandon Flowers discuss what this means for the NBA and if they dropped the ball. Also, Pro Football Hall of Fame 2023 nominees were announced today. Who deserves to get in?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Are the Eagles and Bills the Two Best Teams In the NFL?
item.description: LeSean McCoy, Leger Douzable, Brandon Flowers and Auntie Chantel Tremertiere discuss the action from Monday Night Football, and whether the Eagles and Bills are the two best teams in their respective conferences after dominant wins over the Vikings and Titans. Plus, Auntie's Steelers are looking suspect after the first two games of the season. Will this be the first losing season for Mike Tomlin?

item.title: IAA Tonight | The Return of Jimmy G AND What's Wrong with Pacman's Bengals?
item.description: We celebrate our 100th episode of I AM ATHLETE Tonight by talking about all of the amazing action around the NFL yesterday, including the return of Jimmy Garoppolo after Trey Lance suffered an unfortunate season-ending injury. Plus, are Pacman's Bengals are in serious trouble after losing to the Cowboys without Dak Prescott and falling 0-2 on the season.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Should Phoenix Suns Governor Robert Sarver Be Forced to Sell the Team?
item.description: More fallout from Suns Governor Robert Sarver continues as sponsors have now threatened to seperate themselves from the franchise if he's still in charge. Brandon Marshall, Auntie Chantel Tremetiere and Ashley Nicole Moss dive further into the matter. Plus, former NFL All-Pro and Football Analyst Chad Brown joins to discuss the Steelers, Seahawks and more!

item.title: IAA Tonight | LeBron James and Chris Paul Comment on Robert Sarver's Suspension
item.description: Phoenix Suns and Mercury owner Robert Sarver was banned from the NBA for one year and fined $10 million after the NBA on Tuesday released its findings from a 10-month independent investigation into allegations of workplace abuse during Sarver's tenure as managing partner of the Suns that has spanned nearly two decades. LeBron James and Chris Paul expressed their disappointment in the lack of severity of the punishment for Sarver. Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones and Leger Douzable discuss what the outcome should've been. Plus, Steelers DE T.J. Watt and Seahawks S Jamal Adams suffered severe injuries in Week 1 that will keep them out for some time. The guys give insight on how hard it is to comeback from severe injuries.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Leger Douzable, Adam Pacman Jones)
item.itunes:title: IAA Tonight | LeBron James and Chris Paul Comment on Robert Sarver's Suspension
item.itunes:author: Brandon Marshall, Leger Douzable, Adam Pacman Jones
item.itunes:summary: Phoenix Suns and Mercury owner Robert Sarver was banned from the NBA for one year and fined $10 million after the NBA on Tuesday released its findings from a 10-month independent investigation into allegations of workplace abuse during Sarver's tenure as managing partner of the Suns that has spanned nearly two decades. LeBron James and Chris Paul expressed their disappointment in the lack of severity of the punishment for Sarver. Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones and Leger Douzable discuss what the outcome should've been. Plus, Steelers DE T.J. Watt and Seahawks S Jamal Adams suffered severe injuries in Week 1 that will keep them out for some time. The guys give insight on how hard it is to comeback from severe injuries.
item.itunes:subtitle: Phoenix Suns and Mercury owner Robert Sarver was banned from the NBA for one year and fined $10 million after the NBA on Tuesday released its findings from a 10-month independent investigation into allegations of workplace abuse during Sarver's tenure as managing partner of the Suns that has spanned nearly two decades. LeBron James and Chris Paul expressed their disappointment in the lack of severity of the punishment for Sarver. Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones and Leger Douzable discuss what the outcome should've been. Plus, Steelers DE T.J. Watt and Seahawks S Jamal Adams suffered severe injuries in Week 1 that will keep them out for some time. The guys give insight on how hard it is to comeback from severe injuries.
item.itunes:keywords: football, seattle seahawks, jamal adams, nba, tj watt, phoenix mercury, lebron james, chris paul, nfl, pittsburgh steelers, phoenix suns

item.title: IAA Tonight | Is Pete Carroll Being a Hypocrite?
item.description: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll had some interesting comments about Russell Wilson on Wednesday after defeating his former QB on Monday night. Brandon Marshall used to play for the Seahawks and was not pleased with Carroll's comments.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Brandon MArshall, Omar Kelly, LeSean Mccoy)

item.title: IAA Tonight | They Wrote Geno Off But He Didn't Write Back
item.description: Geno Smith and the Seahawks spoiled Russell Wilson's return to Seattle in a Monday Night thriller. Broncos first year head coach Nathaniel Hackett is under some serious fire for electing to kick a 64-yd FG instead of going for it on 4th & 5 late in the game. Brandon Marshall, LeSean McCoy, Leger Douzable and Omar Kelly discuss this and what the Cowboys should do in Dak's absence.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, LeSean McCoy, Brandon Marshall)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Dallas' Options with Dak Out
item.description: Dak Prescott suffered a thumb injury in the Cowboys season opener, which will keep him out for some time. What options do the Cowboys have at QB to fill in while Dak recovers? Should they pursue a trade for Teddy Bridgewater or Jimmy Garoppolo? Plus, are the Packers in trouble after their abysmal showing week 1 without Davante Adams?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, Adam Pacman Jones)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Will Lamar's Next Big Deal be in Baltimore?
item.description: Since the Ravens and Lamar Jackson can't agree on a deal before his deadline, what will be the next move for the star QB? Could this potentially be the beginning of the end for Lamar being the QB for the Baltimore Ravens. Plus, SiriusXM NFL Radio Host Kirk Morrison joins to discuss the Rams getting wrecked on opening night of the 2022 NFL season. What do the defending Super Bowl champs have to do in order for spectators to believe they can repeat and win it all again?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Ashley Nicole Moss, Omar KElly, Chantel Tremetiere)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Lamar Gives the Ravens a Deadline for a New Deal
item.description: Lamar Jackson has officially given the Ravens until Friday to agree to a new deal or contract talks won't be further discussed until after the season. Why can't the Ravens and Lamar find the correct number that will make both sides happy? Plus, Brandon Marshall, Leger Douzable, and Omar Kelly play Fact or Cap: NFL Opening Weekend Edition.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Our 2022 NFL Bold Predictions AND Tampa Bay Buccaneers Season Preview
item.description: NFL regular season is set to kickoff tomorrow and LeSean McCoy, Adam Pacman Jones and Leger Douzable are here to provide you with their bold predictions for the 2022 season. Find out who Shady believes will win league MVP, who Pac thinks will win Defensive Player of the Year, and who Douz believes will win Rookie of the Year. Plus, we end the Countdown to Kickoff with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. Will Brady and the crew bounceback from a tough playoff loss the Super Bowl Champion LA Rams?

item.title: IAA Tonight | How Much Pressure Is On Tom Brady To Win the Super Bowl Again?
item.description: Is there still pressure on Tom Brady to win another Super Bowl after winning seven rings and being named Super MVP five times? Should Trey Lance be rattled that Jimmy G is still in San Fran as his backup after the team couldn't find a new home for him? Ashley Nicole Moss, LeSean McCoy, Brandon Flowers and Omar Kelly discuss all of that and more!
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (LeSean McCoy, Omar Kelly, Ashley Nicole Moss, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | College Football Headed For a Massive Change AND Tennessee Titans Season Preview
item.description: The College Football Playoff's board of managers unanimously voted Friday to expand the CFP to 12 teams in 2026 but is encouraging the sport's commissioners to try to implement it as soon as 2024. Brandon Marshall, Ashley Nicole Moss and Omar Kelly discuss how this will effect the college football landscape. Countdown to Kickoff's next stop is Nashville with the Tennessee Titans. Are Ryan Tannehill's days numbered as the QB for the squad?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Ashley Nicole Moss, Omar Kelly)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Spida Mitchell Gets Traded to the Cavaliers AND Kansas City Chiefs Season Preview
item.description: Donovan Mitchell is finally traded out of Utah and is headed to Cleveland to play for the up and coming Cavaliers, but is this enough to get Cleveland over the hump and into the playoffs? Antoine Walker and Ashley Nicole Moss get into a passionate debate on whether this was a good move for Cleveland. We continue our Countdown to Kickoff with the Kansas City Chiefs. Find out where Brandon Marshall ranks them in the AFC West.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Dallas Cowboys Season Preview
item.description: LeSean McCoy, Adam Pacman Jones and Leger Douzable preview the Dallas Cowboys for this upcoming season. There's some questions marks in Dallas regarding the offensive line, receiver depth and losing Randy Gregory. Will the Cowboys repeat as NFC East Champions? Plus, Jon Gruden finally speaks, but should he get another chance in football after his unceremonious exit from Las Vegas.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, LeSean McCoy, Adam Pacman Jones)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Pro Football Hall of Famer Rod Woodson AND L.A. Rams Season Preview
item.description: I AM ATHLETE got the chance to speak to Pro Football Hall of Famer Rod Woodson. Tune in to find out what hIs thoughts are on the Hall of Fame selection process. Plus, we preview the Los Angeles Rams 2022 season. Will they repeat as Super Bowl Champs if Matt Stafford isn't fully healthy?

item.title: IAA Tonight | Jimmy G to Remain in San Fran AND Buffalo Bills Preview
item.description: QB Jimmy Garoppolo has agreed to a restructured one-year deal to stay with the San Francisco 49ers.The contract includes a no-trade clause and a no-tag clause. The compensation is reportedly $6.5 million fully guaranteed, with another potential $9.5 million in bonuses. Could Jimmy G's presence rattle Trey Lance's confidence if he starts off poorly? Plus, we preview the Buffalo Bills season. Who's the important player on their roster?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones, Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Recently Retired Shaquem Griffin Stops By AND Arizona Cardinals Preview
item.description: Former NFL player and University of Central Florida standout Shaquem Griffin has officially retired from the NFL is officially 'on to plan A.' Griffin had a chance to catch up with IAA Tonight and discuss what plan A is. Plus, we continue our Countdown to Kickoff with the Arizona Cardinals. What will it take for them to make a deep playoff run this upcoming season?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Shaquem Griffin, Leger Douzable, Omar KElly)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Terrell Owens Makes a Surprise Visit to IAA Tonight
item.description: Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones and Leger Douzable get a surprise visit from none other than Hall of Fame WR Terrell Owens after he calls out Brandon to race him in a 40 yard dash. Plus, Pacmans Bengals got into a heated fight with the Rams today in which Aaron Donald was swinging helmets at Rams players.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones, Leger Douzable, Terrell Owens)

item.title: IAA Tonight | NFL QB Battles AND Las Vegas Raiders Preview
item.description: LeSean McCoy, Ashley Nicole Moss and Leger Douzable debate the best QB training camp battles in the NFL. Will Steelers first round pick Kenny Pickett beat out Mitch Trubisky? Will Drew Lock takeover in Seattle following the footsteps of Russell Wilson? Our Countdown to Kickoff continues with the Las Vegas Raiders. Do the Raiders have the best QB-WR combo in the NFL with Derek Carr and Davante Adams?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (LeSean McCoy, Ashley Nicole Moss, Leger Douzable)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Kevin Durant and the Nets Agree to 'Move Forward'
item.description: Kevin Durant and the Brooklyn Nets ownership have agreed to end his trade request and move forward with the upcoming season, but how long will this relationship actually last? Countdown to Kickoff continues with the New England Patriots. Will Mac Jones make a leap in year two, or is he bound to hit a sophomore slump?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Ashley Nicole Moss, Brandon Flowers, Omar Kelly)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Niners Preview & Thibodeaux's Knee Injury
item.description: We continue our Countdown to Kickoff with a stop in San Francisco to preview the 49ers. Can Trey Lance take the Niners to the next level? Also, the crew discusses NY Giants rookie Kayvon Thibodeaux's knee injury due to a cut block by the Bengals' Thaddeus Moss.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Adam 'Pac Man' Jones, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | LeBron Commits to LA & Colts Preview
item.description: LeBron James signs a two year extension with the Lakers, which coincidently lines him up to be a free agent when his son Bronny could be coming to the NBA. But should the media be leaving Bronny alone? Also, do the Giants have a QB controversy brewing? We continue our Countdown to Kickoff discussing the Indianapolis Colts, who are hoping Matt Ryan can be the guy to get them over the top.

item.description: Kevin Durant continues to make headlines as his standoff with the Nets continues, meanwhile Ben Simmons and the Sixers settled on his grievance to recoup withheld pay from last season. item.title: IAA Tonight | Is the Pressure Really on Tua?
item.description: We continue our Countdown to Kickoff with a stop at the Miami Dolphins. Tua Tagovailoa has been taking a lot of heat since he's entered the league, but is the pressure really on him to perform this season? Plus, Carson Wentz was asked some tough questions recently by a local reporter, and Commanders president Jason Wright wasn't too thrilled at how they were asked. Was Wright correct in his criticism of the questions?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Adam Pacman Jones, Ashley Nicole Moss)

Guyanese-American rapper and singer SAINt JHN joins Brandon Marshall, Adam "Pacman" Jones, and LeSean "Shady" McCoy in episode 46 of I Am Athlete. Watch this episode as SAINt JHN opens up on his childhood, creative process and how he uses manifestation to paint his reality. SAINt JHN also takes us deeper as he shares that he originally wrote the #1 Billboard song "Roses" for Beyoncé to perform several years before he collaborated with her on "Brown Skin Girl" but would go on to perform it himself.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Deion Sanders Criticizes Hall of Fame Credentials
item.description: Pro Football Hall of Famer and Jackson State University Head Football Coach Deion Sanders said the quality for the Hall of Fame has been reduced. Is Prime correct in his assessment of what the Hall of Fame has become? Plus, we continue our Countdown to Kickdown to Kickoff with the Los Angeles Chargers. Will Justin Herbert make the leapto superstardom?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Ashley Nicole Moss, Omar Kelly, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Jimmy G to the Browns? AND Minnesota Vikings Season Preview
item.description: The San Francisco 49ers have been trying to trade Jimmy Garoppolo all offseason and haven't found a suitor yet, but with Deshaun Watson's looming suspension possibly for the entire season, should the Browns pursue Jimmy G? Plus, we continue our Countdown to Kickoff with the Minnesota Vikings. Will Captain Kirk lead the ship to a NFC North division title?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Ashley Nicole Moss, Chantel Tremetiere)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Kansas City Chiefs DL Carlos Dunlap AND Cleveland Browns Season Preview
item.description: Kansas City Chiefs DL Carlos Dunlap stops by to discuss his new coach Andy Reid, Patrick Mahomes and the receivers, and how underrated the defense is. Plus, the Browns have a lot of questions heading into the 2022 season, including the impending suspension of QB Deshaun Watson. Can the Browns make the playoffs if Watson is suspended for an extensive period of time?

item.title: IAA Tonight | Serena Williams Set to Retire AND The Latest on Lamar's Contract
item.description: Perhaps the greatest athlete to ever play the sport of tennis is planning on retiring soon. Leger Douzable, Ashley Nicole Moss and Brandon Flowers reflect on 23x Grand Slam winner Serena Williams' career and what she meant to sports. Plus, Lamar Jackson still hasn't signed a new deal with the Ravens. What's the hold up?

item.description: Brandon and Pacman are currently still on the training camp tour and had the chance to stop by 49ers camp and talk to head coach Kyle Shanahan. Is this Carson Wentz's final shot at being a starter in the NFL?

item.title: IAA Tonight | WNBA Star Brittney Griner Sentenced to 9 years in Russian Prison
item.description: Brittney Griner was found guilty in Russian court and sentenced to nine years in prison for drug possession and drug smuggling with criminal intent. Auntie Chantel Tremitiere, Leger Douzable, and Omar Kelly react to the news of Griner's sentence. Plus, we continue our NFL season preview and head down to the ATL. How will the Falcons look without Matt Ryan at the the helm?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Auntie Chantel Tremitiere, Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly)

item.title: IAA Tonight | The Dolphins Are Disciplined by the NFL
item.description: The Miami Dolphins have been disciplined for tampering after the team was found to have had impermissible contact with Tom Brady and Sean Payton. Was this penalty justified? Leger Douzable, LeSean McCoy & Omar Kelly discuss. Then, the team breaks down the blockbuster trade that saw All-Star outfielder Juan Soto traded to the San Diego Padres. Finally, LA Chargers WR Keenan Allen joins the show from Chargers Training Camp.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, LeSean McCoy, Omar Kelly, Keenan Allen)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Deshaun Watson Receives Six Game Suspension for Sexual Misconduct
item.description: Sue L. Robinson, a former U.S. District Court judge, who was appointed the league’s disciplinary officer this year in an agreement between the NFL and the NFL Players Association has handed down Cleveland Browns QB Deshaun Watson a six game suspension. We check in with Audacy's Legal Analyst Amy Dash to discuss the punishment. Plus, NBA Legend Bill Russell passed away over the weekend. We remember the life and legacy of one of the all time greats.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Antoine Walker, Chantel Tremetiere)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Kyler Murray's Study Clause Has Been Removed
item.description: The Arizona Cardinals have removed the independent study addendum from Kyler Murray's contract after it received significant backlash. Is it too little too late? Plus, Kirk Cousins keeps securing the bag despite Vikings General Manager Kwesi Adofo-Mensah sneak diss towards the QB saying he's not the caliber of Patrick Mahomes or Tom Brady. Should Cousins be concerned about his future in Minnesota? Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, and Brandon Flowers discuss!
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, Brandon Flowers)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Kyler Murray Addresses Contract Clause Criticism
item.description: Arizona Cardinals QB Kyler Murray felt 'disrespected' because people are criticizing his preparation habits after it was revealed in his contract that he has to study film for four hours a week outside of practice. Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones, and Ashley Nicole Moss discuss the fallout of the clause being put in his contract. NFL Free Agent Linebacker Brandon Copeland joins the show to discuss his podcast Money Music Culture and much more!
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones, Ashley Nicole Moss, Brandon Copeland)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Could Boston be Kevin Durant's Next Stop?
item.description: It has been about a month since Brooklyn Nets star Kevin Durant has requested a trade from the team, but there hasn't been any suitors to offer up a good enough deal to the Nets liking. The Celtics have emerged as a possible trade partner, which would include star G Jaylen Brown. How likely is it that this deal could get done? Should Boston even pursue Kevin Durant after reaching the finals last season. Also, we preview the Houston Texans season. Will Davis Mills prove to be the Texans QB of the future?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (LeSean McCoy, Ashley Nicole Moss, Chantel Tremitiere)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Kyler Murray's Contract Stipulation
item.description: Cardinals QB Kyler Murray agreed to a contract extension worth up to $230.5 million with $160 million guaranteed, but the contract comes with an addendum that requires him to study film for four hours per week during the season to stay in compliance with the new deal. LeSean McCoy, Leger Douzable, and Antoine Walker discuss if this is alarming for a star QB to be required to watch film. Plus, will the Detroit Lions improve from their three win 2021 season with the No. 2 overall pick Aidan Hutchinson?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (LeSean McCoy, Leger Douzable, Antoine Walker)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Why So Much Disrespect for Lamar Jackson?
item.description: An anonymous NFL coach had some harsh criticism for Ravens QB Lamar Jackson stating: 'He is just so inconsistent throwing the ball.' Well Brandon Marshall, Adam Pacman Jones, and Leger Douzable think otherwise of the former MVP. Also, we preview the Jacksonville Jaguars 2022 season. Will Trevor Lawrence have a better second year in the league after having a rocky start to his career?

item.title: IAA Tonight | NBA Legend Vince Carter
item.description: 8x NBA All-Star and dunk legend Vince Carter joined Adam Pacman Jones, Leger Douzable, and Omar Kelly to discuss perhaps the all-time greatest dunk contest performance at 2000 All-Star Weekend, dunking over Frédéric Weis of France in the 2000 Summer Olympics, and his new podcast. Plus, Where will Jimmy G land next as the world awaits the 49ers QB to be traded.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Will We Ever See Houston Harden Again?
item.description: James Harden has officially inked a new deal and will return to the Sixers for the 2022-2023 season. Will we see the James Harden of old that used to get buckets and dished dimes at will, or will we see the slowed down Harden that struggled to find his rhythym in Philly at the end of the season? Plus, Dodgers star OF Mookie Betts wore a shirt that said “We need more Black people at the stadium” when warming up for the Midsummer Classic at Dodger Stadium. What will it take to get more black people interested in baseball?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Leger Douzable, Antoine Walker)

item.title: IAA Tonight | LeBron, AD and Russell Westbrook 'Huddle Up' and Commit to Winning in LA
item.description: It was revealed that LeBron James, Anthony Davis, and Russell Westbrook "huddled up" on a phone call recently and expressed their commitment to one another, but will that call make them any better than last season? Auntie Chantel Tremitiere, Leger Douzable, and LeSean McCoy discuss what needs to happen for them in order to win. Plus, we have some burning questions for the 2022 NFL season, and Shady doesn't hold back on former NFL running back Ricky Williams for his recent comments.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Auntie Chantel Tremitiere, Leger Douzable, LeSean McCoy)

Is there some validity in his comments?

item.title: IAA Tonight | What if Kevin Durant was Traded for LeBron James?
item.description: With all the crazy moves that have occured in this NBA offseason, what if we had another one involving perhaps the two best players currently in the league? A proposed Kevin Durant for LeBron James trade could go down as the biggest in NBA history, and Brandon Marshall, Omar Kelly and Auntie Chantel Tremitiere discuss whether both teams should explore it. Plus, an anonymous NFL offensive coach said Saquon Barkley ‘doesn’t know how to play running back.’ Is he correct in his assessment?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Omar Kelly, Auntie Chantel Tremitiere)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Ranking the Top 10 WR's for the 2022 NFL Season
item.description: Brandon Marshall, Omar Kelly, Auntie Chantel Tremitiere, and Ashley Nicole Moss take a deep dive into ranking the top 10 wide receivers heading into the 2022 season. Of course, no one could come to an agreement on who's the best. Plus, who's career would you rather have: 10x NBA All-Star Carmelo Anthony or 4x NBA Champion and Finals MVP Andre Iguodala?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Omar Kelly, Auntie Chantel Tremitiere, Ashley Nicole)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Ranking the Top 10 QB's and Where's Donovan Mitchell's Next Destination?
item.description: ESPN put out a list ranking the top 10 QB's and RB's for the upcoming 2022 season, but Brandon Marshall, Adam 'Pacman' Jones, and Antoine Walker decided to create their own due to some glaring omissions. Plus, Pacman was on vacation and ran into Utah Jazz star G Donovan Mitchell, who may not be there for much longer after some of the moves they've made this offseason.

item.title: IAA Tonight | Damian Lillard Secured the Bag
item.description: Damian Lillard has agreed to two-year, $122 million contract extension with the Portland Trail Blazers that will tie him to the franchise through the 2026-27 season. Brandon Marshall, Auntie Chantel Tremitiere and Ashley Nicole Moss discuss if Dame will remain in Portland for the entire duration of his contract, and what does it mean for his legacy if he never wins a championship with the Blazers.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, Auntie Chantel Tremitiere, Ashley Nicole Moss)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Brittney Griner Pleads Guilty and College Conference Shakeup
item.description: Phoenix Mercury star Brittney Griner pleaded guilty to drug charges in a Russian court on Thursday. Audacy Legal Analyst Amy Dash helps us understand the fallout of her decision as she faces up to 10 years in prison. College conferences could see major realignment in the near future, but why is this happening and which schools should seek to leave their current conference?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Amy Dash, Leger Douzable, Chantel Tremitiere, Omar Kelly)

item.title: IAA Tonight | Giants DL Leonard Williams & Baker Mayfield Finally Gets Traded
item.description: Giants DL Leonard Williams joins Leger Douzable, Adam "Pacman" Jones and LeSean McCoy to discuss how things are going with his new head coach Brian Daboll, QB Daniel Jones, and the No. 5 overall pick in the 2022 NFL Draft Kayvon Thibodeaux. Will Daniel Jones have a breakout season for the Giants? Baker Mayfield was finally traded from the Cleveland Browns to the Carolina Panthers, but does he still have to fight for that starting spot?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Adam "Pacman" Jones, LeSean McCoy, Leonard Williams)

item.title: IAA Tonight | What Will It Take to Get Kevin Durant?
item.description: What should the asking price be for Kevin Durant? Brandon Marshall, LeSean McCoy, Ashley Nicole Moss and Antoine Walker discuss if it's more likely that Durant will be traded before the season, or will he be stuck on the Nets roster while they try to find a trade partner willing to give them everything they want. Plus, is Odell Beckham Jr. overhyped? One of our hosts believes so.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Brandon Marshall, LeSean McCoy, Ashley Nicole Moss, Antoine Walker)

Broadcast journalist and television personality Cari Champion joins Brandon Marshall, Adam "Pacman" Jones, Nick "Swaggy P" Jones in episode 39 of I Am Athlete. Cari worked as an anchor and reporter for the Tennis Channel and as the host of ESPN2's First Take. In July 2014, Cari became an anchor for ESPN's flagship program SportsCenter. After almost eight years at the network, she left ESPN in February 2020. Watch as Cari speaks on her journey in broadcast journalism, women in media, and leaving ESPN and more.

item.title: Kevin Durant's Shocking Trade Request | Best of I AM ATHLETE Tonight Week Nine
item.description: NY Daily News NBA/Nets Writer Kristian Winfield discusses the surprising news that Kevin Durant wants out of Brooklyn. NFL linebacker KJ Wright visits to discuss his future, and who he would like to see as QB of the Seattle Seahawks. Marquette King discusses his situation as the free-agent Pro Bowl punter is still searching for work and a discussion on new media vs. old media.

item.title: Belichick vs. Brady, Congressional Hearing and The NBA Draft | Best of I AM ATHLETE Tonight Week Eight
item.description: Rob Gronkowski has officially retired, which led to a debate on the job Bill Belichick has done with the Patriots and who deserves the most credit: Belichick or Brady. Legal analyst Amy Dash visits to break down what happened in Washington as Roger Goodell met the Congressional Committee investigating Daniel Snyder. Plus, IAA Tonight breakdown the NBA Draft as it happens.
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, Antoine Walker, Adam Jones, Brandon Marshall, Chantel Tremitiere)

item.title: Should Lamar Play Without a New Deal? | Best of I AM ATHLETE Tonight Week Seven
item.description: Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly and Brandon Marshall react to Deshaun Watson speaking to the media at mandatory camp in an effort to clear his name. How should Watson be handling his accusations to the public? Should Kyler Murray become the highest-paid Cardinal in franchise history? Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson spoke to the media and discussed the possibility of playing without a new deal. IAA Tonight breaks down if he should even take a snap before he gets a second contract. The Warriors win their fourth championship in eight years. Is Steph top 10 of all-time?
item.author: smanderville@houseofathlete.com (Leger Douzable, Omar Kelly, Antoine Walker, Adam Pacman Jones, Brandon Marshall, Brandon Flowers)

item.description: This week on I AM ATHLETE Tonight, the guys chat about what makes a superstar; Joel Embiid getting snubbed as a member of 1st team All-NBA; players should have more influence on Hall of Fame and postseason award voting and a chat on Ravens QB Lamar Jackson missing OTAs.

item.title: I Am Athlete | JUSTIN GATLIN on Competing with Usain Bolt & The Future For Sha'carri Richardson
item.description:
SUBSCRIBE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE?sub_confirmation=1 WATCH MORE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE
I AM ATHLETE | Episode 31 Retired Olympic and World Champion sprinter, Justin Gatlin joins Brandon Marshall, Chad Johnson and Omar Kelly in episode 31 of I Am Athlete. Watch as Gatlin discusses his recent decision to retire after 20 years on the track, his competition with Usain Bolt and his relationship with Shacarri Richardson. Gatlin also discusses starting and leading the first USA youth track team overseas to compete in Jamaica. The team will wrap up competition in the states at the AAU Junior Olympic Games in August.

item.title: Presenting Our Newest Daily Show... I AM ATHLETE Tonight
item.description: Welcome to the I AM ATHLETE Tonight podcast! Every weeknight you can catch us SiriusXM's Mad Dog Sports Radio from 7-9PM ET. However, If you weren't able to catch us or you won't to hear us again, you can subscribe to the I AM ATHLETE Tonight podcast, which is where we will have our show uploaded there every weeknight. Please subscribe, rate, and review! In case you missed our opening week on Mad Dog Sports Radio, we talked to Cardinals receiver Marquis "Hollywood" Brown fresh off of getting traded from Baltimore to Arizona, and had our guy Adam "Pac Man" Jones live from the 2022 NFL Draft. Tap In!

item.title: George Kittle and Sanu: Trey Lance Has Insane Ceiling | I AM ATHLETE
item.description:
SUBSCRIBE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE?sub_confirmation=1 WATCH MORE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE
Season 3 | Episode 29 In Episode 29 of I Am Athlete, Brandon Marshall travels to Technogym's headquarters in Cesena, Italy and connects with San Francisco 49ers tight end George Kittle and wide receiver Mohamed Sanu. Watch as Kittle and Sanu discuss the 49er's quarterback battle between Jimmy Garoppolo and Trey Lance, the power of visualization and Kittle's 75 acre Golf course.
Kittle and Sanu also dive deeper into the their personal experience with Technogym. They discuss how Technogym is a leader in the industry and how their products are playing a big role in the future of training for them and other athletes.

item.title: GERVONTA DAVIS: The Truth About Floyd Mayweather and Wanting Ryan Garcia
item.description:
A special episode drop of I AM ATHLETE featuring Gervonta "Tank" Davis, a legend with hosts Brandon Marshall, Chad Ochocinco Johnson, and Adam Caparell, a journalist formerly with Complex.
We are working on a new additional series of I Am Athlete. This potential series can give us an opportunity to sit down with MORE legends in a candid and uncensored environment.
What should we call it? IAA (I Am Athlete) Straight forward , Straight Up, No Cap, Unfiltered, OFFset, UNcut, The Real, NOW, WarmUp, Raw 1stCut, Uncensored, or Ocho's idea... IAA B****
Watch Gervonta's fight vs. Rolando Romero on May 28th!!! Let us know what you think and Comment some title ideas below ⬇️

item.title: I Am Athlete | Colin Kaepernick: Hopes of A 2022 NFL Comeback
item.description:
SUBSCRIBE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE?sub_confirmation=1 WATCH MORE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE
Season 3 | Episode 28 Colin Kaepernick, American civil rights activist and former San Francisco 49ers quarterback sits down with Brandon Marshall, Chad Johnson and Pacman Jones in episode 28 of I Am Athlete. Watch as Kaepernick discusses his passion to still play football and his hopes to gain an opportunity to compete for a starting quarterback role in the NFL.
D.J Williams joins Brandon, Chad, Pacman and Omar Kelly in a deeper discussion following the Kaepernick interview. item.title: I AM ATHLETE | Ja'Marr Chase & Jaylen Waddle: Talks Tyreek Hill, Joe Burrow and Tua Tagovailoa
item.description:
SUBSCRIBE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE?sub_confirmation=1 WATCH MORE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE
I AM ATHLETE | Episode 27 In Episode 27 of of I Am Athlete, Ja'Marr Chase and Jaylen Waddle joins Chad "Ochocinco" Johnson, Pacman and Omar Kelly. Watch as Ja'Marr and Jaylen discuss their rookie season, Joe Burrow, Tua Tagovailoa, Tyreek Hill and goals for the upcoming season.
Ja'Marr shares what his Super Bowl experience was like during his rookie season. He also explains how playing alongside Joe Borrow in college and in the NFL has given him an advantage during his rookie transition. After a successful Super Bowl run in his rookie season, Ja'Marr shares how his quest for the "Triple Crown" is next on his goals list.
Jaylen, The sixth overall 6th round draft pick by the Dolphins discusses his rookie transition from Alabama. He also shares his excitement of being able to play alongside new teammate Tyreek Hill this upcoming season and how he looks forward to learning from him on and off the field.

item.title: I AM ATHLETE: LISA LESLIE on WNBA, Brittney Griner, Business & Investing In The Black Community
item.description:
SUBSCRIBE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE?sub_confirmation=1 WATCH MORE ➡️ https://www.youtube.com/c/IAMATHLETE
Former WNBA Superstar Lisa Leslie joins Brandon Marshall, Chad "Ochocinco" Johnson and Chantel "Auntie" Tremitiere in episode 25 of I Am Athlete. Lisa takes us through the infamous altercation with former WNBA star Lauren Jackson and the incident on the court with former head coach Rick Mahorn. Watch as the crew discuss Brittney Griner, parenting, business and much more.

item.title: I AM ATHLETE | CHRIS JOHNSON Talks Near Death Experience, Embracing Culture & Life After NFL
item.description:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 24
Former NFL running back Chris Johnson joins "I AM ATHLETE" with Brandon Marshall, Chad "Ochocinco" Johnson and Omar Kelly. Chris opens up about embracing his culture while in the NFL, his historic 2000+ yard season and the drive-by shooting that nearly ended his career in 2015.
Chris walks us through the moments leading up to the drive-by shooting that left he and a friend wounded and another dead. After the shooting Chris experienced nerve issues in his hand and struggled with effective rehab solutions. Because of this he feared his injury would lead to the end of his career but ultimately he got the care he needed to recover and continue his NFL career.

item.title: I AM ATHLETE: TRENT WILLIAMS on CANCER BATTLE, ADRIAN PETERSON and LONGEVITY IN THE NFL
item.description:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 23
Brandon Marshall, Chad "Ochocinco" Johnson and Pac-Man Jones welcome NFL offensive tackle for the San Francisco 49ers Trent Williams in Episode 23 of I AM ATHLETE.
Watch as NFL superstar Trent Williams is opens up to “I Am Athlete” about the biggest fight of his life when he was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer and was told death was a very real outcome. The 33-year-old 49ers offensive lineman— widely considered the best in the NFL — was diagnosed with Dermatofibrosarcoma Protuberans in 2019, after noticing an unusual lump on his head. The 9-time Pro Bowler explains how he handled the diagnosis — and ultimately went on to beat cancer and continue his legendary NFL career.

item.title: I AM ATHLETE: LIL WAYNE Talks Young Money's Drake, Nicki Minaj & New Artist Euro
item.description:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 22 Brandon Marshall, Chad "Ochocinco" Johnson, Pac-Man Jones and Omar Kelly welcome Rapper, Singer, Song Writer and Record Executive Lil Wayne in Episode 22 of I AM ATHLETE.
Watch as Lil Wayne discusses everything from his role in the birth of popular hip-hop artist like Drake and Nicki Minaj, embracing an ever-changing hip-hop landscape, and how his goal is to become the "Ultimate Artist".
Lil Wayne introduces his protégé Euro as Ochocinco continues to pressure him into a rap battle while on set. Young Money's Euro steps in and delivers bar after bar as Ocho is then left speechless and defeated.
Wrapping the episode up, Lil Wayne gives his take on Aaron Rodgers' future and how and why he is a loyal Greenbay Packers fan although he is born and raised in New Orleans. Brandon, Ocho and Pac-Man end the show by starting a rap cypher ft artist Euro, Jag, Gorditoflo and Lil Dred. These artist bless the I Am Athlete set as Lil Wayne reacts to the strong performances.

item.title: I AM BLACK | MICHAEL BENNETT on Celebrating The Beauty And Resiliency of The African Diaspora
item.description:
I AM BLACK | Season 2: Episode 3
Athlete, activist, author, and former NFL player, Michael Bennett, along with Athletes for Impact celebrate the beauty and resiliency of the African Diaspora with family and friends. The beginning of the event started out with greetings, connecting and a whole lot of food hosted by African Chop House.
Michael Bennett gives a warm welcome to the audience and explains why he’s doing this event, and the main focus of it. “So this is a great opportunity to not focus on the victimization of it but focus on how we’re building…”.Guerline M. Jozef, President of the Haitian Bridge Alliance started off the panel by focusing on what’s happening down at the Mexican border. She starts to become emotional when explaining how the Haitians who made the journey from Brazil to the United States were being whipped by white people on the back of horses. She explains how the people are just trying to escape their internal crisis by seeking refuge through the United States.
A woman in the crowd speaks up and asks the group “What are the plans to teach us how to fish?” when referring to the analogy of giving a man a fish. The Co-Founder of ‘Black Lives Matter’, Patrisse Cullors and the Founder of Alaffia, Olowo n’djo Tchala both respond to the woman. Patrisse explains how the black community needs to create things that are self-sustaining, and that can be reused, shared but also taken care of over time by other black people. She refers to using black farmers as a way to teach people how to take care of a water source over long periods of time. Olowo explains how he would set people up in the right situations for success if he can. He can teach his students what to do and how to do it, but ultimately it is up to them whether or not they try and get a job and perform the task at hand.
Michael ends the panel by thanking everyone for showing up and thanking the hosts for the conversations that were made.

Athlete, activist, author, and former NFL player, Michael Bennett, along with Athletes for Impact celebrate the beauty and resiliency of the African Diaspora with family and friends. The beginning of the event started out with greetings, connecting and a whole lot of food hosted by African Chop House.
Michael Bennett gives a warm welcome to the audience and explains why he’s doing this event, and the main focus of it. “So this is a great opportunity to not focus on the victimization of it but focus on how we’re building…”.Guerline M. Jozef, President of the Haitian Bridge Alliance started off the panel by focusing on what’s happening down at the Mexican border. She starts to become emotional when explaining how the Haitians who made the journey from Brazil to the United States were being whipped by white people on the back of horses. She explains how the people are just trying to escape their internal crisis by seeking refuge through the United States.
A woman in the crowd speaks up and asks the group “What are the plans to teach us how to fish?” when referring to the analogy of giving a man a fish. The Co-Founder of ‘Black Lives Matter’, Patrisse Cullors and the Founder of Alaffia, Olowo n’djo Tchala both respond to the woman. Patrisse explains how the black community needs to create things that are self-sustaining, and that can be reused, shared but also taken care of over time by other black people. She refers to using black farmers as a way to teach people how to take care of a water source over long periods of time. Olowo explains how he would set people up in the right situations for success if he can. He can teach his students what to do and how to do it, but ultimately it is up to them whether or not they try and get a job and perform the task at hand.
Michael ends the panel by thanking everyone for showing up and thanking the hosts for the conversations that were made.

item.title: I AM ATHLETE: BRIAN FLORES | We Can't Be Silenced
item.description:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 20
Brandon Marshall, Chad Johnson and Omar Kelly welcome former head coach of the Miami Dolphins, Brian Flores. Tune in as they discuss his recent firing, lawsuit against the NFL and what the NFL and ownership needs to do to improve the status of minority leadership hires.
The show opens up with the cast all giving their best shot at defining the "Patriots Way" and how the organization has been able to be so successful over the years. After spending time as an assistant coach with the Patriots, Brian Flores shares that he's learned alot under Bill Belichick but they both still take a different approach to coaching.
The conversation shifts to Brian's recent firing after 3 seasons with Miami and how it came as a surprise to most of the world after he started the season off at 1-7 but ended it with a 9-8 record. Flores shares that he believes his firing was racially driven and how his open lawsuit against the NFL will help minority coaches in the future. Flores also shares his thoughts on ways that the NFL can implement changes right away that can benefit coaches in similar situations in the future.
Brandon wraps the episode up by asking Brian, who is the X and who is the Z. As Brandon and Chad battle it out, Omar shares his thoughts to help move the conversation along. Omar shares that they both are talented receivers in their own ways but he has to go with Chad as the X.
0:00 Cold Open 0:36 Intro 1:09 DraftKings Sportsbook 2:22 Manscaped 4:06 Defining the “Patriot’s Way” 7:21 Brian Flores’s Firing 12:01 Flores’s Inspiration Mel Tucker and Bill Belichick 16:41 State of Black Coaches as Leaders in the NFL 20:37 Rooney Rule and Black Head Coaches in NFL 22:44 Flores’s on Tanking, Winning Culture and Respect 29:10 Flores’s Lawsuit, Unfair Practices and Risk Challenging the NFL 37:42 NFL Ownership and Representation 45:20 Flores’s on How the NFL Can Implement Change 51:35 Flores on His Family and Friends 56:00 Flores on Ways He can Improve as a Coach 58:39 Who’s Your X? Who’s your Z? 1:03:42 Credits 1:05:52 End

item.title: I AM ATHLETE: J.R. Smith Talks NBA Future, Community and Being Misunderstood
item.description:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 19
Brandon Marshall and D.J. Williams welcome J.R. Smith and Antoine Walker to the show as they discuss basketball, HBCU’s, what really happened in the 2018 NBA Finals and much more.
The show opens up with J.R. talking about his time in Denver and what it was like playing with Carmelo Anthony and company. Antoine goes on to talk about the similarities between him and J.R. when it came to how they played the game. Antoine felt judged when playing for the Boston Celtics because of the way he celebrated and showboated around the court. He explains how people looked at him differently because of that and understands the weight J.R. felt from the public eye because he chose to do things differently when he played.
Brandon brings up HBCUs and asks J.R. to explain his thoughts on the topic. J.R. begins by saying how he went to a high school that was predominately white and explains that he never felt as if he was accepted and belonged. He goes on by saying how much he admires Deion Sanders and what he is doing at Jackson State. He explains how there needs to be more Brandon Marshall’s and D.J. Williams’ going to HBCUs to play football in order to see a change in popularity.
The conversation shifts to the 2018 NBA Finals as Brandon asks what really happened during the infamous moment when J.R. chose to hold the ball with seconds left in their tied game with the Golden State Warriors. He talks about the miscommunication between the team which ultimately led to that mistake. He opens up to talk about the struggles he faced mentally after that game with the world putting all the blame on him for what happened. He says, “That’s not my legacy…not if I have something to do with it.” He explains how the world gives you labels and creates your identity for you, when referring to his nickname of ‘Henny God’. He says, “I don’t even drink Hennessy.” He explains how he feels he’s been misrepresented but has finally come to peace with what happened back in 2018.

item.itunes:subtitle:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 19
Brandon Marshall and D.J. Williams welcome J.R. Smith and Antoine Walker to the show as they discuss basketball, HBCU’s, what really happened in the 2018 NBA Finals and much more.
The show opens up with J.R. talking about his time in Denver and what it was like playing with Carmelo Anthony and company. Antoine goes on to talk about the similarities between him and J.R. when it came to how they played the game. Antoine felt judged when playing for the Boston Celtics because of the way he celebrated and showboated around the court. He explains how people looked at him differently because of that and understands the weight J.R. felt from the public eye because he chose to do things differently when he played.
Brandon brings up HBCUs and asks J.R. to explain his thoughts on the topic. J.R. begins by saying how he went to a high school that was predominately white and explains that he never felt as if he was accepted and belonged. He goes on by saying how much he admires Deion Sanders and what he is doing at Jackson State. He explains how there needs to be more Brandon Marshall’s and D.J. Williams’ going to HBCUs to play football in order to see a change in popularity.
The conversation shifts to the 2018 NBA Finals as Brandon asks what really happened during the infamous moment when J.R. chose to hold the ball with seconds left in their tied game with the Golden State Warriors. He talks about the miscommunication between the team which ultimately led to that mistake. He opens up to talk about the struggles he faced mentally after that game with the world putting all the blame on him for what happened. He says, “That’s not my legacy…not if I have something to do with it.” He explains how the world gives you labels and creates your identity for you, when referring to his nickname of ‘Henny God’. He says, “I don’t even drink Hennessy.” He explains how he feels he’s been misrepresented but has finally come to peace with what happened back in 2018.

item.title: I AM ATHLETE: Brandon Marshall and Chad Johnson Sit With NFL Draft Prospects Chris Olave, Zamir White & David Bell
item.description:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 18
Brandon Marshall and Chad “Ochocinco” Johnson welcome Chris Olave, Zamir White and David Bell to the show as they dive into the pre-draft process, future goals as well as hardships that they overcame that helped them grow as individuals.
Brandon starts off by asking each guy what their pre-draft process looks like and some of the challenges that have come with it. David Bell explains how he needs to stay true to himself and follow his own path as he prepares for the draft. He talks about the differences between the level of focus here compared to the college level. He’s watching his diet more than ever because of the amount of money on the line. Chris Olave explains how there are some days you don’t want to get out of bed, but those end up being the best days for training. He admits to not having the best eating habits at the college level. Chad immediately backs Chris’ statement by explaining how what he has eaten has not affected his skill set or the level of production that he’s put on the field. Brandon shifts the conversation and asks Zamir about winning the national championship just a couple weeks ago. Zamir explains how “huge” it was to win that game after all the work he and his teammates put in through the off-season.
Chad asks the group what their future goals are for themselves as they prepare for the NFL. David explains how his short term individual goal is to win Rookie of the Year, while his team goal is to better their record compared to the previous year. Chris explains how he’s “all about the team” and talks about making the team better and winning as many games as possible. Zamir explains how he wants to “grind it out” and put the team and coaches first. Brandon jokes around saying “did they prep y’all to say that?” as their answers were very centered around the team.
The conversation takes a turn to hardships, as David explains losing a friend back in high school to gun violence. He talks about the effect that had on his school and all the students and staff. Brandon asks if there is anything he is focused on when it comes to gun violence. David wants to open a boys and girls club one day to help keep kids off the streets from an early age. Chris talks about how he slipped on a route during one of the biggest games of his career and the ball ended up getting intercepted by a Clemson player. He felt as if he was the reason for that loss. Zamir talks about how his toughest moment started from birth, having to overcome being “different” due to being born with a cleft lip, cleft palate and a leaky kidney. Brandon circles back around with the group to talk about overcoming these hardships and learning how to process them, and not let them haunt you for years until after you’re out of the league.

item.title: I AM ATHLETE: Bun B, Arian Foster, Kendrick Perkins & Lil’ Keke Talk Tom Brady, Lebron James & Music
item.description:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 17
Brandon Marshall and D.J. Williams welcome Bun B, Arian Foster, Kendrick Perkins and Lil’ Keke to the show as they discuss Tom Brady and Aaron Rodgers, as well as the good, the bad and the ugly when it comes to the music industry.
Arian Foster opens up saying he believes Barry Sanders is the G.O.A.T when it comes to the NFL. The group immediately responds with their opinions starting out with D.J. explaining how Tom Brady is an absolute leader and has the seven rings to back him up. Bun B jokes around and says that D.J. has no idea what kind of battery he is putting in Keke’s back right now since Lil’ Keke is a big Tom Brady fanatic. He says “You’re the energizer bunny right now.”
Brandon asks the group which musical artist is most similar to Tom Brady, as well as Aaron Rodgers. Bun B explains how Tom Brady is most related to Jay Z, while Aaron Rodgers is most similar to Naz. He explains how most new quarterbacks inspire to be Tom Brady, similar to rapper inspiring to be Jay Z. He says Aaron Rodgers is most similar to Naz because he doesn’t love the spotlight and then he goes back in the shadows when he’s off the field.
Bun B shifts the conversation forward and talks about how easy it is nowadays to get your music to the consumers. He explains how Jay Z used the rap to perpetuate other business details that made him a billionaire. The same thing happened to P Diddy. Bun B says that most people would rather be famous, than be rich. Brandon laughs and says that they might need to break down this show and turn it into a Part 2.

I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 17
Brandon Marshall and D.J. Williams welcome Bun B, Arian Foster, Kendrick Perkins and Lil’ Keke to the show as they discuss Tom Brady and Aaron Rodgers, as well as the good, the bad and the ugly when it comes to the music industry.
Arian Foster opens up saying he believes Barry Sanders is the G.O.A.T when it comes to the NFL. The group immediately responds with their opinions starting out with D.J. explaining how Tom Brady is an absolute leader and has the seven rings to back him up. Bun B jokes around and says that D.J. has no idea what kind of battery he is putting in Keke’s back right now since Lil’ Keke is a big Tom Brady fanatic. He says “You’re the energizer bunny right now.”
Brandon asks the group which musical artist is most similar to Tom Brady, as well as Aaron Rodgers. Bun B explains how Tom Brady is most related to Jay Z, while Aaron Rodgers is most similar to Naz. He explains how most new quarterbacks inspire to be Tom Brady, similar to rapper inspiring to be Jay Z. He says Aaron Rodgers is most similar to Naz because he doesn’t love the spotlight and then he goes back in the shadows when he’s off the field.
Bun B shifts the conversation forward and talks about how easy it is nowadays to get your music to the consumers. He explains how Jay Z used the rap to perpetuate other business details that made him a billionaire. The same thing happened to P Diddy. Bun B says that most people would rather be famous, than be rich. Brandon laughs and says that they might need to break down this show and turn it into a Part 2.

item.title: I AM NASCAR: COREY LAJOIE on Stacking Pennies
item.description:
WATCH MORE → https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70YdJ...
I AM NASCAR | SEASON 2: EPISODE 15
Brandon Marshall, Channing Crowder and Dion "Rocko" Williams sit down with American professional stock car racing driver and Corey Lajoie. Corey and the cast discusses mental health
Brandon starts the episode by asking what it was like to be good friends with Bubba Wallace, Denny Hamlin, Joey Logono and watch them blossom and become successful drivers without him.
Corey talks about how he went from signing a 5 year deal with Richard Petty Motor Sports to not having anything. Corey tells a story of how he made a tough career decision after being offered a Crew Chief position but turning it down because he still believed in himself and wanted to live the dream and race.
Corey mentions how mental health played a role early in his career and how he started seeing a sports phycologist after his first 7 weeks of competing on the biggest stage of his life. He tells the cast the story of how the motto "Stacking Pennies" came to life and how he used it to recover from one of the lowest moments of his life.

item.title: I AM ATHLETE: Antonio Brown on Mental Health, NFL Future, Tom Brady and More
item.description:
I AM ATHLETE | Season 3: Episode 16
Brandon Marshall, Jared Odrick and Nick “Swaggy P” Young connect with former Tampa Bay Buccaneers wide receiver Antonio “AB” Brown in episode 16 of I Am Athlete. AB is currently at the center of the conversation after he was released by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers for taking his jersey off and running off the field mid-game vs the New York Jets at Met Life Stadium. Brandon and Jared travel across the country from Miami to L.A. to sit down with AB in efforts to find out if AB’s actions were reactionary or responsive.
Antonio sits down with the I Am Athlete crew in a Kumbaya session to answer questions surrounding the week 17, 3rd quarter incident vs the Jets. AB walks the crew through what led up to the moment on the sideline where he made the decision to strip off his shoulder pads, shirt and gloves and throw them into the crowd before running into the locker room as he flashed a peace sign. AB emphasizes that coach Bruce Arians tried to get him to play while he was injured, and that Arians then told him to get the F--- out after brown pleaded with him that he couldn’t play.
Brandon shares how he would have handled the situation with head coach Bruce Arians and then asks Antonio if he thinks he could have handled his situation in differently. AB explains that he doesn’t regret the way that he handled the moment at MetLife Stadium and explains that there isn’t anything wrong with his mental health and that he refuses to compromise his integrity. AB brings mental health into the center of the discussion after he questions how do NFL players maintain their mental health while still protecting and keeping their integrity?
Moving the conversation along, AB reveals that his relationship with Tom Brady is still intact and that he believes Brady is a great leader and that he is one of the best in NFL. Brandon asks AB what quarterbacks he thinks is next in line behind Brady. AB responds that he believes Lamar Jackson is the next greatest NFL quarterback and that everyone needs to give him his flowers now.
Wrapping things up, the group decides to give out “flowers” to those that have made an impact in their lives or others. Brandon, Jared and Swaggy end the episode by sharing that the I Am Athlete family is rooting for him and wishes him the best.
